title: Simple traffic lights going in opposite directions
content: In this tutorial you will learn how to create two simple traffic lights going in opposite directions

Select **LightIntensity** to transform your smartphone in a rgb lamp

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/LightIntensity-Item.png)
this will be used as a traffic light

Scan the QR code with your smartphone.

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/qrscan.png)

Alternatively, click on _Open in this device_ to open the rgb lamp locally.

Do the same with the **Text2Speech** to create a touch button on your device's screen

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/Text2Speech-Item.png)
and the **DataRecorder**

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Items/DataRecorder-Item.png)
this will be used to make the smartphone vibrate when the button is touched.

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/Logic.png) on the sidebar, move the **if** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/if-component.png), and the **comparison** ![comparison](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Logic/comparison-component.png) components to the workspace

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Math/Math.png) on the sidebar, move the **number** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Math/number-component.png) component to the workspace

Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Math/Math.png) on the sidebar, move the **number** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Math/number-component.png) component to the workspace

Move the **Intensity** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/light-monitor-for-plants/intensity.png), the **Text2Speech** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/light-monitor-for-plants/text2speech.png), and the **record-data** ![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/light-monitor-for-plants/record-data.png) components to the workspace, repeat the process for the vibration component and set it to turn off vibration.

Put the components of the previous steps as in the image

![simple lamp](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/light-monitor-for-plants/blocks.png)
the idea is that if the touch button is being touched, the smartphone will vibrate, and if it is not being touched, the smartphone will not vibrate or stop vibrating.

To repeatedly check if the touch button is being touched, we will use the main loop component, which allows us to rerun the code after it has finished executing. Press ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/Devices.png) on the sidebar. Then, move to the workspace the ![input](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/Devices/main-loop-component.png) component and place it as shown in the picture

![QrCode](https://github.com/bellinux/tutorial-protobject/raw/main/images/light-monitor-for-plants/main-loop.png)
